newsitem.title: GERMANY: Frankfurt renews night freighter discount offer.
newsitem.headline: Frankfurt renews night freighter discount offer.

text.p: Flughafen Frankfurt Main AG (FAG) will continue to offer its 50 percent night landing fee discount for new freighter flights despite a zero response to date, a senior cargo official said.

Bernhard Lessmann, the airport's freight logistics marketing manager, said no airline had taken up the offer to introduce or switch freighter services to evening or early morning flights over the last year.

But the offer, launched last August to try to discourage airlines from using what Frankfurt airport regards as cheaper airport rivals such as Amsterdam or Paris, had to be seen as a medium-term measure, he stressed.

"You cannot expect people to turn around timetables within a year. You have to think of the other end (of the route) as well," Lessmann told Reuters, in reference to world time differences and airport operating times.
"We will maintain the offer and expect it to be successful in the medium-term," he added.
The FAG offer of 50 percent lower landing fees for new freighter services applies to services operating between 21.00 hours and midnight and from 05:00-07:00 (local times).
Sufficient slots are freely available at those times for new flights, FAG sources pointed out. -Paul Needham, Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom. Tel +44 171 542 7706; Fax: 5017 -www.racs.com
